How secure are passwords stored in Chrome or Firefox?
description:
(I thought I’d ask here rather than stackoverflow or reddit because I trust people here more, but I don’t know if this takes the community in an unwanted direction)

My main browser has been Chrome ever since they released that video showing how fast it was (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nCgQDjiotG0) (GOD THAT WAS 14 YEARS AGO). In a sudden bout of paranoia I decided to go back and try Firefox (which was what I had used for the DECADE BEFORE. I’ve been using Firefox and Chrome longer than most of you have been alive, haven’t I?)

Anyhow, my next jolt of paranoia came from a button on the Firefox settings tab that said “Import Data”. It had a list of my Chrome profiles. I picked one and clicked import. It imported them.

I was flabbergasted. Shouldn’t the file or database that stores all my browsing data (INCLUDING ALL MY BANK PASSWORDS) be protected in some way? I could spend some time on the internet researching just how Chrome’s profile database works, but I thought I’d ask you all first.

I mean, if Firefox can just reach in and pull off all this data, doesn’t that mean I could write a script called “Chess 4000” that has a little bit of code somewhere that reads your chrome browsing data once you ran it??
description_plain:
(I thought I'd ask here rather than stackoverflow or reddit because I trust people here more, but I don't know if this takes the community in an unwanted direction)

My main browser has been Chrome ever since they released that video showing how fast it was (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nCgQDjiotG0) (GOD THAT WAS 14 YEARS AGO). In a sudden bout of paranoia I decided to go back and try Firefox (which was what I had used for the DECADE BEFORE. I've been using Firefox and Chrome longer than most of you have been alive, haven't I?)

Anyhow, my next jolt of paranoia came from a button on the Firefox settings tab that said "Import Data". It had a list of my Chrome profiles. I picked one and clicked import. It imported them.

I was flabbergasted. Shouldn't the file or database that stores all my browsing data (INCLUDING ALL MY BANK PASSWORDS) be protected in some way? I could spend some time on the internet researching just how Chrome's profile database works, but I thought I'd ask you all first.

I mean, if Firefox can just reach in and pull off all this data, doesn't that mean _I_ could write a script called "Chess 4000" that has a little bit of code somewhere that reads your chrome browsing data once you ran it??
